text:
Hi Team,

A chunked encoding buffer overflow vulnerability was found on an our Apache server. The HTTP specification (RFC 2068, section
3.6) requires web servers to allow a client to break up a request into multiple sections of a specific length. The Apache HTTP
Server has a software flaw that misinterprets the size of the incoming data chunks. If exploited, a remote attacker may be
able to execute arbitrary commands on the host running the vulnerable software. 

Though we use a higher version of Apache, i.e 2.2.11. We found this exception in our WebInspect Report.

Could you please confirm if this bug has been fixed for this version 2.2.11.
As we have gone through the site and confirmed that its fixed in httpd 2.0.37. http://httpd.apache.org/security/vulnerabilities_20.html 

Please find the attached WebInspect Report for your refernce.

Please email me your recoomendations & confimation on Priya.Padige@ge.com

Thankyou,
Priya
creator: Priya.Padige@ge.com
nick@webthing.com
text: Your URL doesn't resolve (unknown host), and your attachment is a Word document.  Can you please provide the report as plain text?

creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
Created attachment 25500
Raw text content of the Word attachment.

Note that the invalid HTTP request (missing line breaks) is contained in the Word document in the same invalid form.

A URL contained in the attachment indicates, this is CVE-2002-0392.

It has been fixed in May 2002 for 2.0 as revisions r95342 and likely also r95331 as part of httpd trunk at that time.

Later revisions of that source code was also the basis for 2.2. A short code inspection for 2.2 shows, that the overflow prevention is still there and a short test against 2.2.14 shows it is still working:

POST /x.html HTTP/1.1
Host: www.myhost.com
Transfer-Encoding: chunked

c00000000
HTTP/1.1 413 Request Entity Too Large

If you can really reproduce the issue with 2.2, then please reopen the issue and provide details.

Note that you Word report contains an invalid HTTP request (line breaks issing).

Regards,

Rainer
creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de

text:
Hi Team,

Thankyou so much for responding back to us. Please find the report in plain text below.

The URLs http://genet-ssodev1.jfwtc.ge.com:80/index.html are our internal URLS which would be accessed only on our GE Network (3. Network).

Sorry for that.

Please confirm if the issue has been fixed in 2.2.11 also? 

As we have got to know from this site http://httpd.apache.org/security/vulnerabilities_20.html  that the Critical Apache Chunked Encoding Vulnerability  has been fixed in httpd 2.0.37. 

Our WebInspect Report also says that this could be a false positive report.But please let us know why is it being captured as an Error.

Thankyou,
Priya
creator: Priya.Padige@ge.com
Priya.Padige@ge.com
text:
Created attachment 25527
WebInspect Report - Apache Encoding Chunk Chars

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: Closing, everything points to a bad vulnerability scanner flagging an ancient CVE.
